thread.title: Alex Trebek Rapping On ‘Jeopardy’ Is Equal Parts Awkward and Awesome
thread.title_full: Alex Trebek Rapping On ‘Jeopardy’ Is Equal Parts Awkward and Awesome

author: Abby Heugel
title: Alex Trebek Rapping On ‘Jeopardy’ Is Equal Parts Awkward and Awesome
text:
Over 3 million people just like you 'Like' us » Like it? Share it! 128 Shares Even though I'm only qualified for the awkward interview portion of Jeopardy , I still love watching the show and delighting in the three or four answers I get right a night. via: YouTube 
And sometimes when you see something on there, you just know it’s going to wind up on the Internet the next day. That’s exactly what I thought when I heard Alex Trebek introduce a category in the College Championships called, no joke, “Let’s rap, kids!” He read lyrics from Kendrick Lamar, Drake, Desiigner, Kanye West, and Lil Wayne in a way that you have to hear to truly appreciate. Here's Alex Trebek rapping Desiigner's "Panda" on #Jeopardy tonight hahaha pic.twitter.com/XBeeRGRB25 — Matt Zampini (@Matt_Zamp) February 21, 2017 "’Cause the F is for Finisher,” y'all. There's a rap category on Jeopardy, and Alex Trebek's got BARS. pic.twitter.com/W5NGCBREdf — Justin Ferguson (@JFergusonAU) February 21, 2017 And thankfully some genius had the idea to set Trebek’s reading to the actual tracks and spaced out his delivery to sync it to the beats— and oddly enough, it kind of works. 
When he was done burning a hole through the mic, Trebek joked, “I was just getting into this rap thing! I’m not too good at it, but I was getting into it!” 
As the YouTube summary so accurately put it “ Jeopardy was lit fam.”
